channel.title: Comments on: Facebook Connect on Web2Ireland

item.title: By: David Gilmer
item.dc:creator: David Gilmer
item.description: Sounds like a handy little gadget, must try it out on my own blog!
item.content:encoded: Sounds like a handy little gadget, must try it out on my own blog!

item.title: By: Conor O'Neill
item.dc:creator: Conor O'Neill
item.description: Thanks Guys. Hope we see you at FB HQ in Dublin soon Dave.
item.content:encoded: Thanks Guys. Hope we see you at FB HQ in Dublin soon Dave.

item.title: By: Fluffy Links - Wednesday January 7th 2009 « Damien Mulley
item.dc:creator: Fluffy Links - Wednesday January 7th 2009 « Damien Mulley
item.description: [...] gets some updates! The Web2Ireland blog now using Facebook [...]
item.content:encoded: [...] gets some updates! The Web2Ireland blog now using Facebook [...]

item.title: By: Dave Morin
item.dc:creator: Dave Morin
item.description: Awesome you guys integrated Facebook Connect! We're excited to have you on board. Hope to get over to Ireland soon.
item.content:encoded: Awesome you guys integrated Facebook Connect! We’re excited to have you on board. Hope to get over to Ireland soon.

item.title: By: Conor O'Neill
item.dc:creator: Conor O'Neill
item.description: Not seeing comments pushed through from Web2Ireland to Facebook. Trying to get to the bottom of this.
item.content:encoded: Not seeing comments pushed through from Web2Ireland to Facebook. Trying to get to the bottom of this.

item.title: By: Colin Fitzpatrick
item.dc:creator: Colin Fitzpatrick
item.description: Excellent work guys, I like this a lot, must get it installed on my own blog. I agree that although Open ID is great in Theory, Facebook's solution has many advantages.
item.content:encoded: Excellent work guys, I like this a lot, must get it installed on my own blog. I agree that although Open ID is great in Theory, Facebook’s solution has many advantages.
